remarks: Lemma for ~ opphllem , which is itself used for ~ mideu . (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 19-Feb-2020.)
statement:
colperpex.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
colperpex.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
colperpex.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
colperpex.l $e |- L = ( LineG ` G ) $.
colperpex.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
mideu.s $e |- S = ( pInvG ` G ) $.
mideu.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
mideu.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
mideulem.1 $e |- ( ph -> A =/= B ) $.
mideulem.2 $e |- ( ph -> Q e. P ) $.
mideulem.3 $e |- ( ph -> O e. P ) $.
mideulem.4 $e |- ( ph -> T e. P ) $.
mideulem.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( A L B ) ( perpG ` G ) ( Q L B ) ) $.
mideulem.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( A L B ) ( perpG ` G ) ( A L O ) ) $.
mideulem.7 $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( A L B ) ) $.
mideulem.8 $e |- ( ph -> T e. ( Q I O ) ) $.
opphllem.1 $e |- ( ph -> R e. P ) $.
opphllem.2 $e |- ( ph -> R e. ( B I Q ) ) $.
opphllem.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- O ) = ( B .- R ) ) $.
mideulem2.1 $e |- ( ph -> X e. P ) $.
mideulem2.2 $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( T I B ) ) $.
mideulem2.3 $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( R I O ) ) $.
mideulem2.4 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. P ) $.
mideulem2.5 $e |- ( ph -> X e. ( ( ( S ` A ) ` O ) I Z ) ) $.
mideulem2.6 $e |- ( ph -> ( X .- Z ) = ( X .- R ) ) $.
mideulem2.7 $e |- ( ph -> M e. P ) $.
mideulem2.8 $e |- ( ph -> R = ( ( S ` M ) ` Z ) ) $.
mideulem2 $p |- ( ph -> B = M ) $.
